channel.title: Liberty BASIC ideal for starters
channel.description:
[size=20pt]Libery BASIC[/size]
Liberty basic is a language i come to find when i was around moparscape i felt this really inspired me to try learn other languages its very easy but has nice features i no theres not much use of it being around but i felt it would get people who browse these sections and think programming might be for them or even those who are just willing to learn i have decided to work on a few tutorials of what i remember but if you are not into tutorials heres a a database of whats avaliable in liberty BASIC.
[URL=http://www.libertybasicuniversity.com/lb4help/]Links Here[/URL]
finally heres the download [URL=http://www.libertybasic.com/download.html]link[/URL]
[size=20pt]Tutorials[/size]
[size=15pt]Variables[/size]
A Variable is used in code to represent a string of numbers. [code=cpp] Number3 = 3 print Number3[/code]
In the the code above the variable is Number3 but your variable can be anything but naming it close to its purpose tends to make it alot easy. Variables can be used with operators.
Operators i know work
Add [code] + [/code] example: [code] num1 = 3 num2 = 1 print num1+num2 [/code]
Minus [code] - [/code] example: [code] num1 = 3 num2 = 1 print num1-num2 [/code]
Times [code] * [/code] example: [code] num1 = 3 num2 = 1 print num1*num2 [/code]
Half [code] / [/code] example: [code] num1 = 3 num2 = 1 print num1/num2 [/code]

item.title: Liberty BASIC ideal for starters
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

As much as I hate to admit it, the first language I learned was QBASIC…I used it for about 20 minutes before my dad told me I was wasting my time and showed me C++.

I suppose implementing something like this in a server for scripting could be useful.

Read full topic

item.title: Liberty BASIC ideal for starters
item.dc:creator: @spankjava spank
item.description:
@spankjava wrote:

[size=20pt]Libery BASIC[/size]

Liberty basic is a language i come to find when i was around moparscape i felt this really inspired me to try learn other languages its very easy but has nice features i no theres not much use of it being around but i felt it would get people who browse these sections and think programming might be for them or even those who are just willing to learn i have decided to work on a few tutorials of what i remember but if you are not into tutorials heres a a database of whats avaliable in liberty BASIC.

Links Here

finally heres the download link

[size=20pt]Tutorials[/size]

[size=15pt]Variables[/size]

A Variable is used in code to represent a string of numbers.

Number3 = 3 print Number3

In the the code above the variable is Number3 but your variable can be anything but naming it close to its purpose tends to make it alot easy. Variables can be used with operators.

Operators i know work

Add

+

example:

num1 = 3
num2 = 1
print num1+num2

Minus

-

example:

num1 = 3
num2 = 1
print num1-num2

Times

*

example:

num1 = 3
num2 = 1
print num1*num2

Half

/

example:

num1 = 3
num2 = 1
print num1/num2
